tweet: Today, with incredible bipartisan support from 84 senators and 305 representatives, we can FINALLY end the crisis on our Southern border.
It has been painful, stressful, and heart-wrenching to watch the crisis at our border worsen with every passing day while my colleagues refused to even acknowledge it.
Facts Matter. My hope in communicating the facts has been restored. If you keep communicating the truth about the facts, eventually the politicizing of an issue can be overcome.
Let this be a lesson to us all: petty, partisan games will never overrule the American people!
Speaker Pelosi does not have the iron grip on her caucus that she thought. They are tired of her blatant disregard for the will of the American people.
After 57 days of obstruction and denial, we are FINALLY passing a border security funding package through Congress and delivering it to President @realDonaldTrump.

We now have the support of enough Democrats to PASS this bill and get it to President @realDonaldTrump's desk TODAY. But still, Speaker Pelosi  & Democrat leadership refuse to allow a vote. This is UNACCEPTABLE.

The Senate passed a bipartisan  border security package yesterday 84-8. It includes funding for border agents to end the crisis at our border. If the House can't pass the same bill, we shouldn't be going home this afternoon & we absolutely shouldn't get a month recess in August.
Had some time before the #CongressionalBaseballGame tonight to sit down with our interns, eat pizza, and answer questions they have about Congress. The future is bright! pic.twitter.com/dSRRSpPHYn

The hypocrisy and political gamesmanship from the other side of the aisle is appalling. 

I cannot stress enough how important it is to find a solution to end the crisis and protect our people.
Tonight, we voted on an extraordinarily partisan bill that should have focused on ending the crisis at our border - the crisis that Democrats have been denying for MONTHS.

We debated supplemental funding for the border in the House tonight. 

Remember, it’s been 56 days since President Trump declared an emergency and asked for Congress to pass funding.
Tonight I argued in support of @realDonaldTrump's energy infrastructure agenda. We must have the room to become energy-dominant on the international stage. https://youtu.be/GpoEVocGJjg
Meanwhile, @SpeakerPelosi is hurting the American people by refusing to allow a vote on the #USMCA which would be a GREAT deal for Oklahoma & our country.

Mexico ratified the #USMCA earlier this week, there's no reason to wait any longer! https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/the_americas/mexico-becomes-first-country-to-ratify-usmca-north-american-trade-deal/2019/06/19/500dd8c0-92b3-11e9-956a-88c291ab5c38_story.html?utm_term=.f588cf775294 …
President @realDonaldTrump is following through on his promises to renegotiate bad deals and put American interests first.
The #USMCA is not only good for American farmers, ranchers, business owners, and consumers, but it's essential to the continued economic growth of our country.
Another week has passed & still no vote on the #USMCA in the House.
Delayed flight, Pilots timed out, another flight canceled....BWI here we come

Anyone denying the crisis on our border hasn't been there to see it for themselves. 

I have, and here's why it's time to end the standoff & give our border patrol the funding they need. https://www.tulsaworld.com/opinion/columnists/u-s-rep-kevin-hern-i-have-seen-the-border/article_cb21eace-dbab-56b6-8843-a5ad45732080.html …

All this to say that the Democratic majority is doing everything in their power to shut our voices out of the legislative process. They want sole control, but that's not how our government was meant to run.
In contrast, when Republicans held the majority last Congress, we allowed 45% of the amendments to be from the Democrats - more than the 38% from Republicans and 17% bipartisan submissions.
Of the amendments that the Democrats allowed for a vote, 73% of them were from Democrats, 11% were bipartisan, and only 16% were from Republicans.
We were voting on amendments until after 1:30am last night on this first appropriations minibus.
At today's @housebudgetGOP  hearing, I asked one of the witnesses if the #GreenNewDeal would kill jobs in Oklahoma, and here's what they said. (spoiler alert: it would) pic.twitter.com/TVBfzpLDSh
The #GreenNewDeal is bad for America & would absolutely destroy the energy sector that Oklahoma's economy depends on. We must put this dangerous legislation to bed once and for all.
I know how hard you work for your paycheck and I'm not going to let the government take that away from you. An additional $600,000 of spending PER FAMILY is inexcusable.
The #GreenNewDeal is costly, dangerous, and out of touch with the wants and needs of most Americans. Liberal elites in DC don't mind spending unimaginable sums of taxpayer dollars, but I do.
